intro: Xylosma boulindae, commonly known as the Congo xylosma, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in local medicine for their purported healing properties. Xylosma boulindae is often found in moist, tropical forests and is adapted to thrive in shaded environments.
